page.title: 01Highbrook - rural Mid-Sussex
page.content: This area of rural Mid-Sussex is situated in the high weald and consists mostly of steep wooded valleys and pasture.It contains parts of the parishes of West Hoathly and Highbrook and of Horsted Keynes.It is intersected by ridge roads running roughly north/south and, for the south east of England is relatively sparsely populated. The largest concentration is the hamlet of Highbrook, where there is a church, a few houses but no shops or pubs. Otherwise there are scattered groups of agricultural cottages and a number of large well-appointed houses. The pleasant scenery and convenient location of this affluent area make it attractive to newcomers who derive their incomes from elsewhere. Its most famous feature is Horsted Keynes station on the Bluebell preseved steam railway.
